com.wisenut.tea20.api
Class TeaClient

java.lang.Object
  com.wisenut.tea20.api.TeaClient

public class TeaClient
extends java.lang.Object

Java API Client. Implementation class for TEA v2.0 Java API Client.

system properties for API:

  • tea2.log.console: enable/disable console log (default: y)
  • tea2.debug: enable/disable debug mode (default: n)
  • tea2.log.file: enable/disable file log (default: n)
  • tea2.log.path: path for file log (default: ./log)

Author:
hkseo@wisenut.co.kr

TeaClient

public TeaClient(java.lang.String ip,
                 int port,
                 int interval,
                 int maxRetry)
Constructor. - alternative constructor for detailed connection control

Parameters:
ip - IP for listener
port - port for listener
interval - maximum interval for connection retry (in ms, 1 .. 2000)
maxRetry - maximum count for retry connection (1 .. 100)

TeaClient

public TeaClient(java.lang.String ip,
                 int port,
                 int initInterval,
                 int maxInterval,
                 int maxRetry,
                 int waitTimeout)
Constructor. - alternative constructor for full connection control

Parameters:
ip - IP for listener
port - port for listener
initInterval - initial interval for connection retry (in ms, 10 .. 2000)
maxInterval - maximum interval for connection retry (in ms, 10 .. 2000)
maxRetry - maximum count for retry connection (1 .. 100)
waitTimeout - timeout for waiting response from listener (1 .. 120000)

setDelimiters

public static void setDelimiters(java.lang.String item,
                                 java.lang.String value,
                                 java.lang.String freq,
                                 java.lang.String weight)
Set delimiters. (" " is not allowed)

Parameters:
item - delimiter between items (null: use default delimiter)
value - delimiter in a item between first sub-item and next one (null: use default delimiter)
freq - delimiter in a item between first sub-item and next frequency value (null: use default delimiter)
weight - delimiter in a item between first sub-item and next weight value (null: use default delimiter)

waitUntilEnd

public void waitUntilEnd(java.lang.String taskId,
                         long interval,
                         long timeout)
Wait until given task's end. (interval of checking task status is given as parameter)

Parameters:
taskId - task id to check
interval - interval of checking status
timeout - limit of total waiting time. after timeout, this function ends waiting. (in case of 0, infinite waiting)

analyzeTopic

public java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.Integer>> analyzeTopic(java.lang.String collectionId,
                                                            java.lang.String[] keywords,
                                                            java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.String>> keywordTopicPairs)
Request topic analysis of given document. (realtime)

Parameters:
collectionId - collection ID
keywords - keywords for input (not null!)
keywordTopicPairs - returning object for (keyword, topic_id) pairs for topic assignment output (must be empty object to get results, no result if it's null)
Returns:
wrapper object for (topic, weight) pairs (weight: 1 to 10000)

analyzeTotally

public java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.Integer>> analyzeTotally(java.lang.String collectionId,
                                                              java.lang.String content,
                                                              java.util.List<java.lang.String> keywords,
                                                              java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.String>> keywordTopicPairs)
Request keyword extraction and topic analysis of given document simultaneously. (realtime)

Parameters:
collectionId - collection ID
content - text content to analyze
keywords - returning object for keyword extraction results (must be an empty object to get results, returns no result if it's null)
keywordTopicPairs - returning object for (keyword, topic_id) pairs for topic assignment output (must be empty object to get results, no result if it's null)
Returns:
wrapper object for (topic, weight) pairs (weight: 1 to 10000)

sortDescending - if set to true, sort result in descending order of document ID

                                int offset,
                                int numCount,
                                int maxKeywords,
                                java.lang.String sortField,
                                boolean sortDescending)
Get list of topics with some additional metadata.

Parameters:
collectionId - collection ID
offset - start position of index to get topics
numCount - number of topics to get
maxKeywords - maximum number of (related) keywords per topic
sortField - field for sorting list. (Use one in SortField class: ID, LABEL, DOC_COUNT)
sortDescending - if set to true, sort result in descending order
Returns:
list of TopicInfo objects

                                   int offset,
                                   int numCount,
                                   int maxKeywords,
                                   java.lang.String sortField,
                                   boolean sortDescending)

query - query string against topic label or keyword

getCustomTrend

public java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.Integer>> getCustomTrend(java.lang.String collectionId,
                                                              java.lang.String analysisId,
                                                              java.lang.String fieldValue,
                                                              java.lang.String query,
                                                              java.lang.String beginDate,
                                                              java.lang.String endDate)
Get custom field trend (time series) information of given analysis ID, custom field value, and keyword constraint(or topic ID, or without constraint for document)

Parameters:
collectionId - collection ID
analysisId - custom field analysis ID
fieldValue - custom field value
query - keyword or topic ID for constraint (follows analysis setting: KEYWORD or TOPIC. "" in the case of DOCUMENT)
beginDate - begin date (form of YYYYmmdd)
endDate - end date (form of YYYYmmdd)
Returns:
(date_label, freq) pairs. date_label: YYYYmmdd form

getCustomTrend

public java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.Integer>> getCustomTrend(java.lang.String collectionId,
                                                              java.lang.String analysisId,
                                                              java.lang.String fieldValue,
                                                              java.lang.String query,
                                                              java.lang.String beginDate,
                                                              java.lang.String endDate,
                                                              java.lang.String interval)
Get custom field trend (time series) information of given analysis ID, custom field value, and keyword constraint(or topic ID, or without constraint for document)

Parameters:
collectionId - collection ID
analysisId - custom field analysis ID
fieldValue - custom field value
query - keyword or topic ID for constraint (follows analysis setting: KEYWORD or TOPIC. "" in the case of DOCUMENT)
beginDate - begin date (form of YYYYmmdd)
endDate - end date (form of YYYYmmdd)
interval - type of trend interval (DAY|MONTH|YEAR)
Returns:
(date_label, freq) pairs. date_label: YYYYmmdd form

getTrend

public java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.Integer>> getTrend(java.lang.String collectionId,
                                                        java.lang.String analysisId,
                                                        java.lang.String query,
                                                        java.lang.String beginDate,
                                                        java.lang.String endDate)
Get trend (time series) information of given analysis ID and keyword constraint(or topic ID, or without constraint for document) (It's general case without specific custom field. But setting for custom field analysis is required)

Parameters:
collectionId - collection ID
analysisId - custom field analysis ID
query - keyword or topic ID for constraint (follows analysis setting: KEYWORD or TOPIC. "" in the case of DOCUMENT)
beginDate - begin date (form of YYYYmmdd)
endDate - end date (form of YYYYmmdd)
Returns:
(date_label, freq) pairs. date_label: YYYYmmdd form

getTrend

public java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.Integer>> getTrend(java.lang.String collectionId,
                                                        java.lang.String analysisId,
                                                        java.lang.String query,
                                                        java.lang.String beginDate,
                                                        java.lang.String endDate,
                                                        java.lang.String interval)
Get trend (time series) information of given analysis ID and keyword constraint(or topic ID, or without constraint for document) (It's general case without specific custom field. But setting for custom field analysis is required)

Parameters:
collectionId - collection ID
analysisId - custom field analysis ID
query - keyword or topic ID for constraint (follows analysis setting: KEYWORD or TOPIC. "" in the case of DOCUMENT)
beginDate - begin date (form of YYYYmmdd)
endDate - end date (form of YYYYmmdd)
interval - type of trend interval (DAY|MONTH|YEAR)
Returns:
(date_label, freq) pairs. date_label: YYYYmmdd form

                                                                            int maxCount)

Parameters:
collectionId - collection id
analysisId - custom field analysis ID
query - value constraint (can be given value in TOPIC or KEYWORD, according to custom field analysis settings)
maxCount - maximum number of items to get
Returns:
(custom_field_item, freq) pairs
